{"step_by_step_thinking": "The radiological features of transient tachypnoea of the newborn are described in several documents. Document [0] mentions reticulonodular structural increases, extended vessels with unsharp outlines, and small interlobar fissure. Document [2] and [4] mention a radiopaque line - fluid - in the horizontal fissure of the right lung, fluid infiltrate throughout alveoli or fluid in individual lung lobes, and hyperinflated lungs. Document [24] mentions prominent central vascular markings, fluid in the lung fissures, overaeration, and occasionally a small pleural effusion. Among the options, the prominent horizontal fissure is mentioned in the documents.", "answer_choice": "C"}
